name: infrastructure
info: Railway network topology and topography, position wrt topology, location on a map, geometry, aka. alignment

structs.name: TopoArea
structs.info: Defines a container for rail network topology

attrs.name: id
attrs.info: Identity of the object; used for referencing

attrs.name: versionTimestamp
attrs.info: version information which is valid since timestamp

attrs.name: linearElements
attrs.info: composes of linear elements = Edges in the graph

attrs.name: netRelations
attrs.info: composes of net relations =links between edges in the graph

attrs.name: name
attrs.info: User-friendly name, only if different from id

structs.name: LinearElement
structs.info: A linear element is an uninterrupted stretch of railway track, without divergence or convergence.

attrs.name: id
attrs.info: Identity of the object; used for referencing

attrs.name: lengthOfNetLinearElement
attrs.info: Defines the distance along the LinearElement's track centre line.

attrs.name: name
attrs.info: User-friendly name, only if different from id

structs.name: NetRelation
structs.info: Defines a relation between two elements.

attrs.name: id
attrs.info: Identity of the object; used for referencing

attrs.name: elementA
attrs.info: References the first linear element in an oriented relation.

attrs.name: elementB
attrs.info: References the second linear element in an oriented relation.

attrs.name: isOnOriginOfElementA
attrs.info: Determines if the position of the topological element A in a relation is the origin of element A.

attrs.name: isOnOriginOfElementB
attrs.info: Determines if the position of the topological element B in a relation is the origin of element B.

structs.name: TopologicalCoordinate
structs.info: Defines a topological coordinates on the track

attrs.name: onLinearElement
attrs.info: is positioned on linear element

attrs.name: offsetFromOrigin
attrs.info: position on the associated NetElement

structs.name: NetPointReference
structs.info: Represents a point reference in the network.

attrs.name: hasTopoCoordinate
attrs.info: Defines the topological coordinate of a network point reference

attrs.name: appliesToDirection
attrs.info: The direction relative to the origin of the linear element towards the point reference applies

structs.name: LinearElementSection
structs.info: Defines a directed linear object (with a linear extension) located on a LinearElement

attrs.name: onElement
attrs.info: refers to linear element

attrs.name: startOffsetFromOrigin
attrs.info: Defines the start offset from the origin

attrs.name: endOffsetFromOrigin
attrs.info: Defines the end offset from the origin

attrs.name: appliesInBothDirections
attrs.info: Defines if the section applies in both directions

structs.name: NetLinearReference
structs.info: Defines a linked path on the topology

attrs.name: startsAt
attrs.info: Definesthe starting coordinate of a linear reference

attrs.name: endsAt
attrs.info: Defines the ending coordinate of a linear reference.

attrs.name: hasSequence
attrs.info: Defines a sequence of linearElements from the start to the end excluding those defined in startAt- and endsAt-TopologicalCoodinates.

structs.name: NetAreaReference
structs.info: Represents an area reference in the network.

attrs.name: includes
attrs.info: List of linear references included in an network area reference.

attrs.name: includes
attrs.info: List of linear references included in an network area reference.

structs.name: GeometryArea
structs.info: Defines the container geometry area within INFRA Domain

attrs.name: id
attrs.info: Identity of the object; used for referencing

attrs.name: versionTimestamp
attrs.info: version information which is valid since timestamp

attrs.name: alignment3d
attrs.info: Defines the 3d alignment information for the geometry area. if true, all positions and length calculated on 3d line. if false - on 2d projection

attrs.name: linearElementGeometries
attrs.info: composes of linear element geometries

structs.name: LinearElementGeometry
structs.info: Defines the geometry of the linear element centre line as a list of parametrised curves. The geometry is smooth; no discontinuities in azimuth or inclination.

attrs.name: id
attrs.info: Identity of the object; used for referencing

attrs.name: horizontalAlignments
attrs.info: Defines a sequence of geometric primitives, i.e. arc, line or clothoid, that compose this track geometry

attrs.name: verticalAlignments
attrs.info: Defines a sequence of geometric primitives, i.e. arc, line or clothoid, that compose this track geometry

attrs.name: cantPoints
attrs.info: Defines the cant points along the linear element. The linear element must be completely defined, at least at beginning and end. Empty means undefined

structs.name: HorizontalSegment
structs.info: Defines a curvi-linear geometric primitive, mathematically represents a horizontal segment of the centre line of a railway track

attrs.name: horizontalSegmentLine
attrs.info: composes of lines

attrs.name: horizontalSegmentArc
attrs.info: composes of arcs

attrs.name: horizontalSegmentTransition
attrs.info: composes of transition curves

structs.name: HorizontalLine
structs.info: Defines the geometric primitive for a horizontal linear segment

attrs.name: elementGeometryPos
attrs.info: Defines the position on the associated Linear Element

attrs.name: azimuth
attrs.info: Defines the azimuth at pos, i.e. bearing measured clockwise with respect to geographic north

structs.name: HorizontalArc
structs.info: Defines the geometric primitive for a horizontal arc of circle

attrs.name: elementGeometryPos
attrs.info: position on the associated LinearElement

attrs.name: azimuth
attrs.info: Defines the azimuth at pos, i.e. bearing measured clockwise with respect to geographic north

attrs.name: radius
attrs.info: Defines the radius at pos, negative-counter-clockwise/left-curve, positive-clockwise/right-curve

structs.name: HorizontalTransition
structs.info: Defines a geometric primitive for a horizontal transition curve, a clothoid.

attrs.name: elementGeometryPos
attrs.info: position on the associated Linear Element

attrs.name: azimuth
attrs.info: Defines the azimuth at pos, i.e. bearing measured clockwise with respect to geographic north

attrs.name: radius
attrs.info: Defines the radius at pos, negative-counter-clockwise/left-curve, positive-clockwise/right-curve

attrs.name: transitionType
attrs.info: defines different transition types

structs.name: VerticalSegment
structs.info: Defines a curvi-linear geometric primitive, mathematically represents a vertical segment of the centre line of a railway track

attrs.name: verticalSegmentLine
attrs.info: composes of lines

attrs.name: verticalSegmentArc
attrs.info: composes of arcs

structs.name: VerticalLine
structs.info: Defines the geometric primitive for vertical linear segment

attrs.name: elementGeometryPos
attrs.info: position on the associated LinearElement

attrs.name: slope
attrs.info: Defines the vertical slope at pos, between the horizon and the track centre line. Viewed in the direction of the track edge. Positive for rising slope and negative for falling slope.

structs.name: VerticalArc
structs.info: Defines the geometric primitive for a vertical arc.

attrs.name: elementGeometryPos
attrs.info: position on the associated LinearElement

attrs.name: slope
attrs.info: Defines the vertical slope at pos, between the horizon and the track centre line. Viewed in the direction of the track edge. Positive for rising slope and negative for falling slope.

attrs.name: radius
attrs.info: Defines the radius at pos, negative-counter-clockwise/left-curve, positive-clockwise/right-curve

attrs.name: arcType
attrs.info: Defines the type of Arc. For more details seehttps://ifc43-docs.standards.buildingsmart.org/IFC/RELEASE/IFC4x3/HTML/lexical/IfcAlignmentVerticalSegmentTypeEnum.htm

structs.name: CantPoint
structs.info: Defines Cant (Superelevation) at the locations of start and end Cant Ramps on the track.

attrs.name: elementGeometryPos
attrs.info: position on the associated track edge

attrs.name: appliedCant
attrs.info: Height of the outer rail minus the inner rail. Outer rail and inner rail are defined according to the direction of curve. Rollangle=(arcsin(cant/gauge)), gauge is distance between middle of the railheads, e.g. 1500mm for EU-standard gauge '1435mm' ; The applied cant is defined for the start

structs.name: SampledGeometryArea
structs.info: Defines the container sampled geometry area within INFRA Domain

attrs.name: id
attrs.info: Identity of the object; used for referencing

attrs.name: versionTimestamp
attrs.info: version information which is valid since timestamp

attrs.name: sampledLinearElementGeometries
attrs.info: composes of sampled linear element geometries

structs.name: SampledLinearElementGeometry
structs.info: Defines the container sampled linear element geometry within INFRA Domain

attrs.name: id
attrs.info: Identity of the object; used for referencing

attrs.name: slopes
attrs.info: composes of slope sample points

attrs.name: curves
attrs.info: composes of curve sample points

attrs.name: cants
attrs.info: composes of cant sample points

structs.name: SlopeSamplePoint
structs.info: Defines the Slope (gradient) of the track at a given location on the track.

attrs.name: pos
attrs.info: position on the associated LinearElement

attrs.name: samplePointSlope
attrs.info: Defines the vertical slope at pos, between the horizon and the track centre line. Viewed in the direction of the LinearElement. Positive for rising slope and negative for falling slope.

structs.name: CantSamplePoint
structs.info: Defines the cant(superelevation) of the track at a given location on the track.

attrs.name: pos
attrs.info: position on the associated LinearElement

attrs.name: samplePointCant
attrs.info: Defines the height of the outer rail minus the inner rail. Outer rail and inner rail are defined according to the direction of curve.Rollangle=(arcsin(cant/gauge), gauge is distance between centers of rail-heads, e.g. 1500mm for EU-standard gauge.

structs.name: CurveSamplePoint
structs.info: Defines curve (radius) of the track at a given location on the track.

attrs.name: pos
attrs.info: position on the associated LinearElement

attrs.name: sampleCurveRadius
attrs.info: Defines the radius at pos, negative-counter-clockwise/left-curve, positive-clockwise/right-curve

structs.name: Switch
structs.info: A unit of track comprising two fixed rails (stock rails) and two movable rails (switch rails) used to direct vehicles from one track to another track.

attrs.name: id
attrs.info: Identity of the object; used for referencing ; structure refers to EULYNX EU.SAS.77

attrs.name: reversalTime
attrs.info: Defines the time in seconds to switch from one position to the other ; 0 means unknown

attrs.name: pointLeft
attrs.info: NetRelation referencing the left side of the point in the facing direction of the simple point

attrs.name: pointRight
attrs.info: NetRelation referencing the right side of the point in the facing direction of the simple point

attrs.name: name
attrs.info: User-friendly name, only if different from id

structs.name: SlipCrossing
structs.info: Defines the physical track asset Slip Crossing ; 2 instances simple point define a single slip crossing and 4 instances of simple point defined a double slip crossing ; Reversal time is the maximum of known reversal times of simple points. If the reversal time of at least one simple point in the slip point is unknown, the reversal time of the slip point is unknown as well.

attrs.name: id
attrs.info: Identity of the object; used for referencing

attrs.name: switches
attrs.info: Consists of simple points

attrs.name: crossing
attrs.info: Consists of crossing

attrs.name: name
attrs.info: User-friendly name, only if different from id

structs.name: Derailer
structs.info: Defines the physical track asset Derailer

attrs.name: id
attrs.info: Identity of the object; used for referencing

attrs.name: netPointReference
attrs.info: Defines position on LinearElement

attrs.name: reversalTime
attrs.info: Defines the time in seconds to switch from one position to the other ; 0 means unknown

attrs.name: derailToRight
attrs.info: Defines the side on which the derailer derails. If false = derailToLeft

attrs.name: name
attrs.info: User-friendly name, only if different from id

structs.name: Crossing
structs.info: Defines the physical track asset Crossing without possibility to switch between two track edges

attrs.name: id
attrs.info: Identity of the object; used for referencing

attrs.name: topologicalCoordinates
attrs.info: composes of topological coordinates

attrs.name: isSwitchable
attrs.info: True: If the crossing is switchable ; False: If the crossing is not switchable ;https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/Category:Switched_diamond_crossings

attrs.name: name
attrs.info: User-friendly name, only if different from id

structs.name: BaliseGroup
structs.info: Defines a group of balises.

attrs.name: id
attrs.info: Identity of the object; used for referencing

attrs.name: nid_bg
attrs.info: national identifier of the balise group

attrs.name: nid_c
attrs.info: country identifier of the balise group

attrs.name: balises
attrs.info: Defines the balises within the balise group. ETCS-positionInGroup is equal to the position this array

attrs.name: bgFunction
attrs.info: Defines the function of the balise. To be clarified, if derivable from baliseTelegram

attrs.name: linkOrientationDirection
attrs.info: defines linking orientation direction along the LinearElement

structs.name: Balise
structs.info: Defines a technical device on the railway trackbed

attrs.name: id
attrs.info: Identity of the object; used for referencing

attrs.name: topologicalCoordinate
attrs.info: location on TrackEdge

structs.name: PropertiesArea
structs.info: Defines the container properties area within INFRA Domain

attrs.name: id
attrs.info: Identity of the object; used for referencing

attrs.name: versionTimestamp
attrs.info: version information which is valid since timestamp

attrs.name: gauge
attrs.info: Defines the default gauge in the area. Deviations are covered in trackEdgeGauges

attrs.name: loadingGaugeTypes
attrs.info: Defines a list of supported loading gauges per default

attrs.name: defaultVoltage
attrs.info: defines default Voltage

attrs.name: defaultMaxCurrent
attrs.info: Defines the deafult maximun current for the section of track. Used in ATO & ETCS.packet40

attrs.name: linearElementSpeedProfiles
attrs.info: composes of linear element speed profiles

attrs.name: linearElementGauges
attrs.info: composes of linear element gauges

attrs.name: linearElementLoadingGauges
attrs.info: composes of linear element loading gauges

attrs.name: trackConditions
attrs.info: composes of track conditions

attrs.name: currentLimitations
attrs.info: composes of current limitation

attrs.name: permittedBrakingDistances
attrs.info: composes of permitted braking distances

attrs.name: tractionSystems
attrs.info: composes of traction systems

structs.name: LinearElementGauge
structs.info: Defines the inner distance between two rails, e.g. 1432 for EU-standard-rails

attrs.name: linearElementSections
attrs.info: composes of track edge sections

attrs.name: gauge
attrs.info: defines different track gauges

structs.name: LinearElementLoadingGauge
structs.info: Defines linear element loading gauge on the track

attrs.name: linearElementSections
attrs.info: composes of track edge sections

attrs.name: loadingGaugeType
attrs.info: defines different loafing gauges

structs.name: TrackCondition
structs.info: Defines the TrackConditions for a section of track

attrs.name: linearElementSections
attrs.info: composes of track edge sections

attrs.name: conditionType
attrs.info: defines different track conditions

structs.name: CurrentLimitation
structs.info: Defines max current for a list of track sections

attrs.name: linearElementSections
attrs.info: composes of track edge sections

attrs.name: maxCurrent
attrs.info: defines max current value

structs.name: PermittedBrakingDistance
structs.info: Defines max allowed braking distance for a list of linear element sections or segment profile

attrs.name: linearElementSections
attrs.info: Defines the set of linear element sections composing the application area

attrs.name: distance
attrs.info: Defines the applicable permitted braking distance

attrs.name: brakeType
attrs.info: Defines the applicable brake type for permitted braking distance

attrs.name: gradientValue
attrs.info: Defines the gradient value.Required Resolution is 0.1 permill; positiv: uphill, negative: downhill

attrs.name: sameDir
attrs.info: Defines the usage direction of the linear element ;true: active in same direction as linear element, false: active in opposite direction

structs.name: TractionSystem
structs.info: Defines the equipped traction system on the track

attrs.name: linearElementSections
attrs.info: composes of track edge sections

attrs.name: voltageType
attrs.info: defines the different voltage types

structs.name: TrackUsageArea
structs.info: Defines the preferred usage specification, most usable for TMS and planning

attrs.name: id
attrs.info: Identity of the object; used for referencing

attrs.name: versionTimestamp
attrs.info: version information which is valid since timestamp

attrs.name: secondaryTracks
attrs.info: Defines the list of secondary tracks. All tracks except 'shuntingTracks' and 'secondaryTracks' are 'mainTracks'

attrs.name: shuntingTracks
attrs.info: Defines the list of shunting tracks. All tracks except 'shuntingTracks' and 'secondaryTracks' are 'mainTracks'

attrs.name: preferredSameDir
attrs.info: Defines the list of linear elements with preferred direction identical to the Linear element-Direction

attrs.name: preferredOppositeDir
attrs.info: Defines the list of linear elements with preferred direction opposite to the Linear element-Direction

structs.name: LinearElementSpeedProfile
structs.info: Defines the permitted speeds for a linear element in both directions

attrs.name: id
attrs.info: Identity of the object; used for referencing

attrs.name: sameDirProfile
attrs.info: Defines the speed profile valid in the same direction as the Linear element

attrs.name: oppositeDirProfile
attrs.info: Defines the applicable speed profile for the opposite direction of travel with reference to linear element. valid in the opposite direction as the TrackEdge. Skip if the same in both directions.

structs.name: SpeedProfile
structs.info: Defines the different applicable speed profiles on the sections of track

attrs.name: staticSpeedProfile
attrs.info: composes of static speed profiles

attrs.name: axleLoadSpeedProfiles
attrs.info: composes of axle load speed profiles

structs.name: StaticSpeedLimit
structs.info: Defines the static speed profile for a section of linear element

attrs.name: pos
attrs.info: position on the associated LinearElement

attrs.name: speed
attrs.info: Defines the applicable speed for the section of track ; Resolution min 5 kmph

attrs.name: specificStaticSpeedLimits
attrs.info: composes of specific static speed profiles

structs.name: SpecificStaticSpeedLimit
structs.info: Defines the specific static speed profile for a section of track

attrs.name: speed
attrs.info: Defines the applicablespeed for the section of track ; Resolution min 5 kmph

attrs.name: specificLimitCategory
attrs.info: defines different specific speed limit categories

structs.name: SpeedLimitCategory
structs.info: Defines the different applicable speed limit categories on the sections of track

attrs.name: otherCategoryReplacesCantDeficiencySSP
attrs.info: is of type other Category Replaces Cant Deficiency SSP

attrs.name: otherCategoryDoesNotReplaceCantDeficiencySSP
attrs.info: is of type other Category Replaces Cant Deficiency SSP

attrs.name: cantDeficiencyCategory
attrs.info: is of type Cant Deficiency Category

structs.name: AxleLoadSpeedProfile
structs.info: Defines the axle load speed profile for a section of track or a section of SegmentProfile

attrs.name: startPos
attrs.info: Defines the start position on the associated Linear element

attrs.name: endPos
attrs.info: Defines the end position on the associated Linear element

attrs.name: speed
attrs.info: Defines the applicablespeed for the section of track ; Resolution min 5 kmph

attrs.name: axleLoadCategory
attrs.info: defines different axle load categories

structs.name: ETCSMarker
structs.info: Defines the ETCS Marker Boards

attrs.name: id
attrs.info: Identity of the object; used for referencing

attrs.name: netPointReference
attrs.info: Defines position on LinearElement

attrs.name: markerFunctionStop
attrs.info: Defines the function associated with the ETCS marker board. true=stop, false=location (when the ETCS marker is a location marker)

attrs.name: name
attrs.info: User-friendly name, only if different from id

structs.name: StopLocation
structs.info: Defines the stop locations

attrs.name: id
attrs.info: Identity of the object; used for referencing

attrs.name: netPointReference
attrs.info: Defines position on LinearElement

attrs.name: stopTrainLimit
attrs.info: composes of stop train limits

attrs.name: trainLoadType
attrs.info: composes of train load types

attrs.name: doorOpeningSide
attrs.info: defines different train opening sides

attrs.name: name
attrs.info: User-friendly name, only if different from id

structs.name: StopTrainLimit
structs.info: Defines the different stop limits for train on the track

attrs.name: trainMaxLength
attrs.info: Defines the maximum train length associated with stop train limit. use zero if not defined

attrs.name: trainMaxAxles
attrs.info: Defines the maximum train axles associated with stop train limit. use zero if not defined

attrs.name: trainMaxWagons
attrs.info: Defines the maximum train wagons associated with stope train limit. including Locomotives, use zero if not defined

attrs.name: trainMaxSize
attrs.info: Defines the size of train applicable for this stop train limit. use undefinedTrainSize if not defined

structs.name: PlatformEdge
structs.info: Platform for the purpose of RINF is understood as a platform edge. A platform concerns only the part of the structure neighbouring to the track (interfaced with trains).

attrs.name: platformId
attrs.info: Unique platform identification or unique platform number within an Operational Point.

attrs.name: name
attrs.info: User-friendly name, only if different from id

attrs.name: linearReference
attrs.info: composes of linked path

attrs.name: stopLocations
attrs.info: Defines the stop locations. Add only, if stopLocation can be used on that PlatformEdge for passenger/freight exchange

attrs.name: platformHeight
attrs.info: Distance between the upper surface of platform and running surface of the neighbouring track. It is the nominal value expressed in millimetres.

structs.name: Platform
structs.info: Defines the object platform

attrs.name: id
attrs.info: Identity of the object; used for referencing

attrs.name: name
attrs.info: User-friendly name, only if different from id

attrs.name: platformEdges
attrs.info: composes of platform edges

structs.name: OperationalPoint
structs.info: An operational point (OP) means any location for train service operations, where train services may begin and end or change route, and where passenger or freight services may be provided; operational point also means any location at boundaries between Member States or infrastructure managers. In https://eur-lex.europa.eu/eli/reg_impl/2019/773/oj 2.1.2 Principal locations (stations, yards, junctions, freight terminals).

attrs.name: uopid
attrs.info: Code composed of country code and alphanumeric operational point code.

attrs.name: opName
attrs.info: Name normally related to the town or village or to traffic control purpose.

attrs.name: travelTimeMeasurementPoints
attrs.info: Defined to measure/define timestamps for passing trains. Stopping-timingPoints can be found via platforms.platformEdges.stopLocations and timingPoint.stopLocation

attrs.name: opType
attrs.info: Defines the Type of operational point in relation to the dominating operational functions.

attrs.name: platforms
attrs.info: Defines the sequence of platforms is according to the real location, so neighbours are the same in array and reality

structs.name: TravelTimeMeasurementPoint
structs.info: Defines the passing time through an OperationalPoint measured at the middle of it

attrs.name: id
attrs.info: Identity of the object; used for referencing

structs.name: TimingPoint
structs.info: Defines a fixed point on the infrastructure

attrs.name: id
attrs.info: Identity of the object; used for referencing

attrs.name: activeObject
attrs.info: Defines the functional object infront of which a TimingPoint is located and is active

attrs.name: name
attrs.info: User-friendly name, only if different from id

structs.name: TPActiveObject
structs.info: Defines a functional object infront of which a TimingPoint is located and active

attrs.name: etcsMarker
attrs.info: refers to ETCS marker

attrs.name: stopLocation
attrs.info: refers to stop location

attrs.name: timeMeasurePoint
attrs.info: refers to travel time measurement point

structs.name: Tunnel
structs.info: A railway tunnel is an excavation or a construction around the track provided to allow the railway to pass for example higher land, buildings or water.

attrs.name: tunnelIdentification
attrs.info: Unique tunnel identification or unique tunnel number within Member State

attrs.name: name
attrs.info: User-friendly name, only if different from id

attrs.name: tunnelTubes
attrs.info: composes of tunnel tubes

structs.name: TunnelTube
structs.info: Defines the tunnels tubes within a tunnel. Main Use-Case identify emergency management with rescue into neighbour tube

attrs.name: areaReference
attrs.info: composes of track area

attrs.name: crossSection
attrs.info: Defines the standard Cross section dimensions of a tunnel for calculation of air-resistance

structs.info: Defines the train detector system for the train vacancy proving section

attrs.name: trainDetectorType
attrs.info: Defines the train detection system applicable for the TVPS

attrs.name: referenceDir
attrs.info: Reference direction corresponding to linear element in which the train detector detects trains: same/opposite for axleCounter, both for trackCircuit

structs.name: LevelCrossing
structs.info: A level crossing is an intersection where a railway line crosses a road or a path at the same level. It can be used for the implementation of the ETCS trackside or to identify potential collision scenarios

attrs.info: Identity of the object; used for referencing

attrs.name: areaReference
attrs.info: composes of track area

attrs.name: name
attrs.info: User-friendly name, only if different from id

structs.name: NationalBorder
structs.info: Defines a border point is used to separate the railway network due to different reasons. Typical examples are country borders, the change of owning infrastructure manager or the border of a station

attrs.name: fromCountryCode
attrs.info: Defines the from country code for the national border in the direction of linear element

attrs.name: toCountryCode
attrs.info: Defines the to country code for the national border in the direction of linear element

attrs.name: name
attrs.info: User-friendly name, only if different from id
